( Ask, Seek, Knock) ( ( 470 7:7-12 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [Jesus] said πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτούς <WG846> autous them , Τίς <WG5101> Tis “ [Suppose one] ἐξ <WG1537> ex of ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn you ἕξει <WG2192> hexei - φίλον <WG5384> philon [his] friend καὶ <WG2532> kai - πορεύσεται <WG4198> poreusetai goes πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτὸν <WG846> auton - μεσονυκτίου <WG3317> mesonyktiou at midnight καὶ <WG2532> kai and εἴπῃ <WG2036> eipē says αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . , Φίλε <WG5384> Phile ‘ Friend , χρῆσόν <WG5531> chrēson lend μοι <WG1473> moi me τρεῖς <WG5140> treis three ἄρτους <WG740> artous loaves [of bread] ,

ἐπειδὴ <WG1894> epeidē because φίλος <WG5384> philos [a] friend μου <WG1473> mou of mine παρεγένετο <WG3854> paregeneto has come ἐξ <WG1537> ex on ὁδοῦ <WG3598> hodou a journey , πρός <WG4314> pros to με <WG1473> me me καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐκ <WG3756> ouk nothing ἔχω <WG2192> echō I have ὃ <WG3739> ho - παραθήσω <WG3908> parathēsō to set before αὐτῷ <WG846> autō him . ’

Κἀκεῖνος <WG2548> Kakeinos And [suppose the one] ἔσωθεν <WG2081> esōthen inside ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis answers εἴπῃ <WG2036> eipē . . . , Μή <WG3361> Mē ‘ Do not μοι <WG1473> moi me . κόπους <WG2873> kopous bother πάρεχε <WG3930> pareche vvv ἤδη <WG2235> ēdē is already ἡ <WG3588> hē [My] θύρα <WG2374> thyra door κέκλεισται <WG2808> kekleistai shut , καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὰ <WG3588> ta - παιδία <WG3813> paidia children μου <WG1473> mou my μετ’ <WG3326> met’ and ἐμοῦ <WG1473> emou I εἰς <WG1519> eis in τὴν <WG3588> tēn - κοίτην <WG2845> koitēn bed . εἰσίν <WG1510> eisin are οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv δύναμαι <WG1410> dynamai I cannot ἀναστὰς <WG450> anastas get up δοῦναί <WG1325> dounai to give σοι <WG4771> soi you [anything] . ’

Τίνα <WG5101> Tina What δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐξ <WG1537> ex among ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn you , τὸν <WG3588> ton - πατέρα <WG3962> patera father αἰτήσει <WG154> aitēsei asks for ὁ <WG3588> ho [if his] υἱὸς <WG5207> huios son ἰχθύν <WG2486> ichthyn a fish , ( BYZ and TR if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone, or for a fish; see .) καὶ* <WG2532> kai instead ἀντὶ <WG473> anti . . . ἰχθύος <WG2486> ichthyos . . . ? ὄφιν <WG3789> ophin a snake αὐτῷ <WG846> autō him ἐπιδώσει <WG1929> epidōsei will give

ἢ <WG2228> ē Or καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . αἰτήσει <WG154> aitēsei [if] he asks for ᾠόν <WG5609> ōon an egg , ἐπιδώσει <WG1929> epidōsei will give αὐτῷ <WG846> autō him σκορπίον <WG4651> skorpion a scorpion ?

( A House Divided) ( ( 470 12:22-30 ; 480 3:20-27 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [One day] ἦν <WG1510> ēn [Jesus] was ἐκβάλλων <WG1544> ekballōn driving out δαιμόνιον <WG1140> daimonion a demon καὶ <WG2532> kai αὐτὸ <WG846> auto that ἦν <WG1510> ēn was κωφόν <WG2974> kōphon mute . ἐγένετο <WG1096> egeneto . . . δὲ <WG1161> de And when τοῦ <WG3588> tou the δαιμονίου <WG1140> daimoniou demon ἐξελθόντος <WG1831> exelthontos was gone , ἐλάλησεν <WG2980> elalēsen spoke . ὁ <WG3588> ho the κωφός <WG2974> kōphos [man who had been] mute καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐθαύμασαν <WG2296> ethaumasan were amazed , οἱ <WG3588> hoi The ὄχλοι <WG3793> ochloi crowds

τινὲς <WG5100> tines some δὲ <WG1161> de but ἐξ <WG1537> ex of αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them εἶπον* <WG2036> eipon said , Ἐν <WG1722> En “ [It is] by Βεελζεβοὺλ <WG954> Beelzeboul Beelzebul , ( WH Beezeboul; Vulgate Beelzebub; also in verses 18 and 19) τῷ <WG3588> tō the ἄρχοντι <WG758> archonti prince τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the δαιμονίων <WG1140> daimoniōn demons , ἐκβάλλει <WG1544> ekballei [that] He drives out τὰ <WG3588> ta - δαιμόνια <WG1140> daimonia demons . ”

Ὅταν <WG3752> Hotan When ὁ <WG3588> ho - ἰσχυρὸς <WG2478> ischyros a strong [man] , καθωπλισμένος <WG2528> kathōplismenos fully armed , φυλάσσῃ <WG5442> phylassē guards τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἑαυτοῦ <WG1438> heautou his αὐλήν <WG833> aulēn house , ἐν <WG1722> en vvv εἰρήνῃ <WG1515> eirēnē secure . ἐστὶν <WG1510> estin are τὰ <WG3588> ta - ὑπάρχοντα <WG5225> hyparchonta possessions αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

τότε <WG5119> tote Then πορεύεται <WG4198> poreuetai it goes καὶ <WG2532> kai and παραλαμβάνει <WG3880> paralambanei brings ἕτερα <WG2087> hetera other πνεύματα <WG4151> pneumata spirits πονηρότερα <WG4190> ponērotera more wicked ἑαυτοῦ <WG1438> heautou than itself , ἑπτά <WG2033> hepta seven καὶ <WG2532> kai and εἰσελθόντα <WG1525> eiselthonta they go in κατοικεῖ <WG2730> katoikei [and] dwell ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei there . καὶ <WG2532> kai And γίνεται <WG1096> ginetai is τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἔσχατα <WG2078> eschata final [plight] τοῦ <WG3588> tou - ἀνθρώπου <WG444> anthrōpou man ἐκείνου <WG1565> ekeinou of that χείρονα <WG5501> cheirona worse τῶν <WG3588> tōn than the πρώτων <WG4413> prōtōn first . ”

Ἐγένετο <WG1096> Egeneto . . . ( True Blessedness) δὲ <WG1161> de As ἐν <WG1722> en . . . τῷ <WG3588> tō - λέγειν <WG3004> legein was saying αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta these things , ἐπάρασά <WG1869> eparasa raised τις <WG5100> tis a φωνὴν <WG5456> phōnēn [her] voice γυνὴ <WG1135> gynē woman ἐκ <WG1537> ek in τοῦ <WG3588> tou the ὄχλου <WG3793> ochlou crowd εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - , Μακαρία <WG3107> Makaria “ Blessed ἡ <WG3588> hē [is] the κοιλία <WG2836> koilia womb ἡ <WG3588> hē - βαστάσασά <WG941> bastasasa that bore σε <WG4771> se You , καὶ <WG2532> kai and [blessed are] μαστοὶ <WG3149> mastoi [the] breasts οὓς <WG3739> hous that ἐθήλασας <WG2337> ethēlasas nursed You ! ”
